acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96-hour LC50=29000microg/L of fishes (Sheepshead minnow), and others (MOE Risk Assessment No.1, 2002).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rat LD50 value: >4800mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data, 1999) and rabbit LD50 value: >11900mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data, 1999, ACGIH 7th, 2001, PATTY 4th, 1994),  >=10000mg/kg (NTP TR429, 1995) and 23800mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data, 1999), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Calculated based on the following values: Rat LD50 value: 2400mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data (1999))  6900mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data (1999), ACGIH 7th (2001), PATTY 4th (1994)), 8200mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment the 1st volume (2002)) and 8400mg/kg (NTP TR429 (1995)). Since the calculated values was 5158mg/kg, it was considered as out of category.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it was classified into D in EPA (1993 revision) (IRIS, 2005), it was considered as the outside of Category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 93% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=1.6 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There is a negative result (IRIS, 2005) by the dominant lethal test using a mouse, which is an in vivo multigeneration mutagenicity test using a germ cell, and there is a negative result (NTP DB, 2005) by the micronucleus test which used the rat and mouse erythrocyte, which are the in vivo mutagenicity tests using a somatic. So it carried out the outside of Category.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: It was considered as out of category based on the description that reproductive toxicity was not observed also at the dose in which general toxicity was observed in the dam animals in the mixed feed oral administration study using the pregnancy rat (CERI Hazard Data (1999), MOE Risk Assessment the 1st volume (2002), NTP TR429 (1995), and NTP DB (2005)), and the description that abnormalities were not seen in the fetus in dam toxicity dose at the mouse in the study which carried out mixed feed oral administration (NTP TR429 (1995)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is the descriptions that very mild - mild irritation was acknowledged by application to the eyes of the rabbits (CERI Hazard Data (1999), ACGIH (7th, 2001) and PATTY (4th, 1994)), we judged that ocular irritational property was mild. And we classified it as Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: From description that skin irritation was not admitted in the test which was carried out repetitive application in the skin of the rabbit (CERI Hazard Data (1999), ACGIH (7th, 2001), PATTY (4th, 1994)), and from description that skin irritation was not reported in the humans (CERI Hazard Data (1999), the 1st volume of MOE Risk Assessment Category (2002), and ACGIH (7th, 2001)), it was carried out the outside of Category.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: CERI Hazard Data (1999), MOE Risk Assessment the 1st volume (2002), and ACGIH (7th, 2001) have description that it has no report of sensitizing property in human, however, we have no animal data with which we can clearly deny sensitizing property, therefore we presupposed that we could not classify it for the data is insufficient for determining it to be Out Of Category.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: From description in CERI Hazard Data (1999), MOE Risk Assessment the 1st volume (2002), ACGIH (7th, 2001), PATTY (4th, 1994), and NTP TR429 (1995) that the central nervous system depression is caused or may be caused in oral ingestion in humans, it was judged that anesthetic actions were indicated and was set as Category 3 (anesthetic actions).
